page.title: 02GOOSTREY VILLAGE - HOUSING
page.content:
Goostrey village dates from an early age and is mentioned in the Domesday book, when it was spelt "Gostre". Some old buildings still exist particularly along the main road, but much of the village dates from the late 1960s and 1970s, when many new houses were built.
Expansion of the village has been strictly controlled because of the proximity to Jodrell Bank telescope.
There is a considerable amount of movement of families in and out of the village. Although many of the houses are only 10 to 15 years old the present occupants may well be the third or fourth family to live there.
